title: Fun in Charlotte: Hispanic celebration, Kozol lecture, Biketoberfest!
text:
La Celebración de Espíritu 
LaCa Projects, 1429 Bryant St. 
Thursday, 4 - 8 p.m.: Celebrate the final day of Hispanic Heritage Month with live music and dance performances, tour artist studios, paint on a community mural, taste Latin American taps and more. lacccharlotte.com 
Jonathan Kozol Lecture 
Lilly Family Gallery, Chambers Building, 200 D Road, Davidson 
Thursday, 7-9 p.m.: At Davidson College, the renowned author, teacher and education theorist and activist gives a talk about his life and his career, as well as his thoughts on today’s greatest challenges in public schools. For more information, contact Kathryn Perez, kaperez@davidson.edu. 
Antigone and Lysistrata 
Charles LaBorde Theater, 1415 Beatties Ford Road 
Friday, 7 p.m.: Northwest School of the Arts Theatre presents an evening of comedy and tragedy. Tickets $5 students, $7 adults, nwsatag.com. 
Huntersville Fall Festival 
Barnette Elementary, 13659 Beatties Ford Road, Huntersville 
Saturday, 10 a.m. - 4 p.m.: Enjoy carnival games, hayrides, local vendors, candied apples from Kilwin’s, pumpkins and more. Free. www.huntersvillefallfest.com 
Sustain Charlotte’s Biketoberfest 
Triple C Brewing, 2900 Griffith St. 
Saturday, 3-10 p.m.: Bike, walk or ride the light rail around town to sponsoring businesses while obtaining stamps in your Biketoberfest Passport from 3-7 p.m., and enjoy the after-party at Triple C afterward. Registration $15, www.sustaincharlotte.com/biketoberfest. Related content
